Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “This recount reaffirmed what we already knew from the June 18th primary. It really is amazing what we can achieve when we work as a team. It is an honor to be the VA 05 Republican nominee. I want to thank God and extend my sincere thanks to my family, to everyone who helped out on this campaign, to the people who endorsed and supported me, and to Donald J. Trump. Folks in the 5th District can rest assured that should they elect me in November, they will have an effective fighter in Congress who will get the job done. I look forward to working with Trump to defeat Kamala Harris and to helping elect Hung Cao in November. Now is the time to set our differences aside and unite as a party. Together we will Make America Great Again!”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: McGuire, a former Navy Seal, (once again) declared his victory in a recent statement

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “We have secure and fair elections in Virginia, and Virginians can have confidence in the final results of this race,”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Governor Glenn Youngkin wrote via social media

Named Person Sources.Sourced Statement: “I want to thank the more than 31,000 voters of the 5th District who voted for me in the June 18 primary, and the thousands who volunteered, contributed, prayed, and supported my re-election campaign. While I am disappointed in the ultimate outcome, it has been my distinct honor to serve as the congressional representative for Virginia’s 5th District over the past 3.5 years.”
Named Person Sources.Source Justification: Good, who is also the Chair for the House Freedom Caucus, released this statement following the result
